Uh...I'm assuming from the question that you're having problems with symmetry mode. If that's the case, I've got no ideas.

Otherwise , you're in the SPH - hit the X key on your keyboard. Or push that button with the big square on it just to the right of where the cost of your craft is indicated, there at the bottom on the lefthand side. For good measure, you can also push the button immediately to the right of that; the circle in the center will change into a hexagon and things will start "clicking" to certain angles and such. C-key on your keyboard does the same thing.

Let me guess: You started with the fuselage, added the wing and now want a second fuselage next to it?

If I am correct you're in for a though one. You'll have to build the second fuselage manually and it can be difficult to make everything symmetrical.

The easiest way (and I do hope you actually did this) is to start with in the center the wing, then add the fuselages with simple mirror symmetry.

Yes, that is correct. The fuselage will not always attach in the exact orientation you want. And this is also the reason why you can't simply duplicate the fuselage. This is the way the game works, very little (read: nothing) can be done about it.

If you want symmetry building from the center is the only option.
I'm not sure wings can be the root part. It might be better to start with a small structural piece, like the small I-beam, and build out from there with symmetry.

Try this mod:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/43208-0-22-Oct17-SelectRoot-Set-a-new-root-part-0-22-fixes
